label: 三角縁神獣鏡
本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
見出し読み: さんかくぶちしんじゅうきょう
説明文: a triangular-rimmed mirror decorated with images of deities and beasts. Some such mirrors were reportedly sent by the Chinese Wei Dynasty monarch to Queen Himiko of Wa in the third century, and many such mirrors have been found buried in third- and fourth-century round keyhole tombs (zenpôkôenfun 前方後円墳).
